com.google.code.siren4j.converter
Class ResourceRegistryImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.siren4j.converter.ResourceRegistryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceRegistry
public class ResourceRegistryImpl
extends Object
implements ResourceRegistry

The resource registry keeps a list of all Siren4J Resources as defined by their Siren4JEntity annotation. The name is used as the classname. The names therefore must be unique on the classpath. If two of the same named resources are found then an exception will be thrown during classpath scanning. This is required for the ReflectingConverter.toObject(com.google.code.siren4j.component.Entity) method so it can figure out which classes to reconstitute.

putEntry

public void putEntry(String entityName,
                     Class<?> clazz,
                     boolean overwrite)
              throws Siren4JException
Description copied from interface: ResourceRegistry
Puts an entry into the registry. This can also overwrite existing entries if the flag is set. This method is exposed for testing and edge cases and should be used with care.

Specified by:
putEntry in interface ResourceRegistry
Parameters:
entityName - cannot be null or empty.
clazz - cannot be null.
overwrite - if true then overwriting of an existing entry will be allowed, if false then an exception will be thrown if attempting to overwrite an existing entry.
Throws:
Siren4JException - if an overwrite is attempted and the flag is not true.
